commit_message:
Fix web-server memory overrun when downloading objects from Swift

To prevent memory overrun when downloading large objects from Swift
* `resp_chunk_size` keyword should be passed to swiftclient
* `obj.data` iterator returned from swiftclient is passed to HttpResponse
  (or StreamingHttpResponse for Django>=1.5) as usual since both response
  classes work with iterators/files/byte strings (yet StreamingHttpResponse
  does it better).

The commit introduces new setting SWIFT_FILE_TRANSFER_CHUNK_SIZE that
defines the size of chunk in bytes for Swift objects downloading.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I18e5809b86bfa24948dc642da2a55dffaa1a4ce1
Closes-Bug: #1427819
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/161204/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CHUNK_SIZE = 512 * 1024 * 1024 obj = api.swift.swift_get_object(request, container_name, object_path, resp_chunk_size=CHUNK_SIZE) response = http.CompatibleStreamingHttpResponse(obj.data)
deleted_lines: obj = api.swift.swift_get_object(request, container_name, object_path) response = http.HttpResponse() response.write(obj.data)

subject: Reorder tox environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-30 20:57:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/7f974d4b852cfc8a4241b6bde4a33e94d4a1b68e', 'message': 'Reorder tox environments

If py34 is run after py2x, it results in a "db type could not be

py34 first.

Change-Id: Id81e127e71ecd04a2ed16ab899d6fbf0d15bfee3
'}]
commit_message:
Reorder tox environments

If py34 is run after py2x, it results in a "db type could not be
determined" error.  The only current way to avoid that is to run
py34 first.

Change-Id: Id81e127e71ecd04a2ed16ab899d6fbf0d15bfee3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/87/169087/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py34,py26,py27,pep8

subject: Add html source code on test failure for debugging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-23 21:50:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/d0b6bc52729b5bc4befb462d41c11b3a5d500170', 'message': "Add html source code on test failure for debugging

Sometimes it is not possible to reproduce failure in integration test
locally. Adding html source code of page where failure happened should
increase our ability to debug properly errors on the gates.For this
purpose is used addDetail method from testtools package.

Following changes were done:

* TestCase and AdminTestCase classes were modified in order to share
  common functionality and remove code repetition.

* Testcases have been modified in order to use newly introduce class
  variables(TEST_USER_NAME, TEST_PASSWORD, CONFIG).

* Method get_page_source has been created in the BasePage class this
  method uses javascript innerHTML attribute in order to make
  javascript modification to the page visible in the output. (javascript
  modificaton would not been visible if webdriver's property page_source
  has beend used)

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I064405337fb68c966da007f2a5bf91d5c0ec2b3d

commit_message:
Add html source code on test failure for debugging

Sometimes it is not possible to reproduce failure in integration test
locally. Adding html source code of page where failure happened should
increase our ability to debug properly errors on the gates. For this
purpose the addDetail method from testtools package is used.

Following changes were done:

* TestCase and AdminTestCase classes were modified in order to share
  common functionality and remove code repetition.

* Testcases have been modified in order to use newly introduce class
  variables(TEST_USER_NAME, TEST_PASSWORD, CONFIG).

* Methods _get_page_html_source and _dump_page_html_source have been created
  in the BaseTestCase class. _get_page_html_source uses javascript innerHTML
  attribute in order to make javascript modification to the page visible
  in the output. (javascript modificaton would not have been visible if
  webdriver's property page_source was used)

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I064405337fb68c966da007f2a5bf91d5c0ec2b3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/61/158461/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _root_element_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'html') @property def root_element(self): return self._get_element(*self._root_element_locator) def get_page_source(self): """Gets html page source. self.driver.page_source is not used on purpose because it does not display html code generated/changed by javascript. """ return self.root_element.get_attribute("innerHTML")

commit_message:
Docs on HardwareManager, building, and workflow

Documentation on IPA hardware managers, how to build an IPA ramdisk
and some ways Ironic interacts with the IPA API.

Change-Id: I94db188e1e1333e71437f551d1dfe00acdd7fc8a
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@servercobra.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/22/168522/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Overview ========How it works ============ Integration with Ironic ----------------------- Compatible Deploy Drivers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Agent Deploy Driver <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< The ironic-python-agent works with the agent Deploy driver in Ironic to provision nodes. Starting with ironic-python-agent running on a ramdisk on thePXE Deploy Driver <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<as of the Kilo OpenStack Ironic release. Lookup ~~~~~~ On startup, the agent performs a lookup in Ironic to determine it's node UUID. It does this by sending a hardware profile to the Ironic vendor_passthru lookup endpoint ``/v1/nodes/{node_ident}/vendor_passthru/heartbeat``. Heartbeat ~~~~~~~~~ After successfully looking up its node, the agent heartbeats every N seconds, where N is the Ironic conductor's agent.heartbeat_timeout value multiplied by a number between .3 and .6. After the agent heartbeats, the conductor performs any actions needed against the node; including querying status of an already run command, or beginning cleaning on a node in CLEANING state, for example. Image Builders -------------- Unlike most other python software, ironic-python-agent requires building before use. This is because it's not installed in an operating system, but instead is exclusively run from within a ramdisk. CoreOS ~~~~~~ The only current supported ramdisk image for ironic-python-agent is a CoreOS pxe image [0]_. Build process <<<<<<<<<<<<< On a high level, the build steps are as follows: 1) A docker build is performed using the ``Dockerfile`` in the root of the ironic-python-agent project. 2) The resulting docker image is exported to a filesystem image. 3) The filesystem image, along with a cloud-config.yml [1]_, are embedded into the CoreOS PXE image at /usr/share/oem/. 4) On boot, the ironic-python-agent filesystem image is extracted and run inside a systemd-nspawn container. /usr/share/oem is mounted into this container as /mnt. Customizing the image <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< There are several methods you can use to customize the ironic-python-agent ramdisk. * Embed SSH keys by putting an authorized_keys file in /usr/share/oem/ * Add your own hardware managers by modifying the Dockerfile to install additional python packages. * Modify the cloud-config.yml [1]_ to perform additional tasks at boottime. disk-image-builder <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< There is currently no production-ready ironic-python-agent ramdisk images using disk-image-builder, but one is currently under development. Hardware Managers ================= What is a HardwareManager? -------------------------- IDK, LOL Why build a custom HardwareManager? ----------------------------------- Custom hardware managers allow you to include hardware specific tools, files and cleaning steps in the Ironic Python Agent. For example, you could include a BIOS flashing utility and BIOS file in a custom ramdisk. Your custom hardware manager could expose a cleaning step that calls the the flashing utility and flashes the packaged BIOS version (or even download it from a tested web server). How can I build a custom HardwareManager? ----------------------------------------- Custom HardwareManagers should subclass hardware.HardwareManager or hardware.GenericHardwareManager. The only required method is evalutate_hardware_support(), which should return one of the enums in hardware.HardwareSupport. Hardware support determines which hardware manager is executed first for a given function (see: "`How are methods executed on HardwareManagers?`_" for more info). Common methods you may want to implement are list_hardware_info(), to add additional hardware the GenericHardwareManager is unable to identify and erase_devices(), to erase devices in ways other than ATA secure erase or shredding. Versioning ~~~~~~~~~~ Each hardware manager has a name a version. This version is used during a node's cleaning to ensure the same version of the agent is used during the entire process. If the version changes, cleaning will be restarted from the beginning to ensure consistent cleaning operations and to make updating the agent in production simpler. You can set the version of your hardware manager by creating a class variable named 'HARDWARE_MANAGER_VERSION', which should be a string. The default value is '1.0'. You should change this version string any time you update your hardware manager. You can also change the name your hardware manager presents by creating a class variable called HARDWARE_MANAGER_NAME, which is a string. The name defaults to the class name. How are methods executed on HardwareManagers? ---------------------------------------------=================================:maxdepth: 1 api/autoindex References ========== 0 CoreOS PXE Images - https://coreos.com/docs/running-coreos/bare-metal/booting-with-pxe/ 1 CoreOS Cloud Init - https://coreos.com/docs/cluster-management/setup/cloudinit-cloud-config/

commit_message:
Add a feature variable for port mac address update

Neutron allows the 'mac_address' of a port to be updated starting in
kilo-2.  In order to add tempest tests for this minor feature, we need
a switch so the test can skip on earlier releases.

Change-Id: I82fdfc14fa96ae288c1874e227e34356cd86befd
Partial-bug: #1426002
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/22/162322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PORT_MAC_UPDATE_ENABLED=$(trueorfalse True PORT_MAC_UPDATE_ENABLED) iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG network-feature-enabled port_mac_update "$PORT_MAC_UPDATE_ENABLED"

commit_message:
Added additional core related cpu and aggregated disk metrics

Added 1 additional cpu core metrics and 2 rollup disk metrics.
Added a configuration parameter to the disk plugin configuration
to enable/disable the aggregated disk metrics. Also added additional
documentation to the README file to reflect how to add dimensions
to a plugin instance.

Change-Id: I7e73f7103afa1e3e366769d56eb91233f5513726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/58/165258/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rollup_dimensions = dimensions.copy() send_rollup_stats = instance.get("send_rollup_stats", True) total_capacity = 0 total_used = 0 total_capacity += disk_usage.total total_used += disk_usage.used if send_rollup_stats: self.gauge("disk.total_mb", total_capacity/1048576, dimensions=rollup_dimensions) self.gauge("disk.total_used_mb", total_used/1048576, dimensions=rollup_dimensions) self.gauge("disk.total_free_mb", (total_capacity-total_used)/1048576, dimensions=rollup_dimensions) self.gauge("disk.total_used_perc", round((float(total_used)/total_capacity)*100, 2), dimensions=rollup_dimensions) self.gauge("disk.total_free_perc", round((float(total_capacity-total_used)/total_capacity)*100, 2), dimensions=rollup_dimensions) log.debug('Collected 5 rolled-up disk usage metrics')

commit_message:
Define bridge/port fixtures for OVS/LinuxBridge/Veth backends

This change defines for OVS, LinuxBridge and veth[1] bridge and port
fixture classes in order to handle bridge and port setUp/cleanUp.

It allows to simplify BaseOVSLinuxTestCase[2] and remove
BaseBridgeTestCase[2].

[1] veth backend simulates a bridge with a veth
[2] in neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux.base

Change-Id: If34c9a8fb6fa584fb1e30173ec619d1aac9701f9

self.bridge = bridge def setUp(self): super(OVSBridgeFixture, self).setUp() ovs = ovs_lib.BaseOVS() self.bridge = base.create_resource(BR_PREFIX, ovs.add_bridge) self.addCleanup(self.bridge.destroy) def create_port_in_ns_fixture(self, ns_ip_wrapper): return OVSNamespacePortFixture(self.bridge, ns_ip_wrapper) class OVSNamespacePortFixture(NamespacePortFixture): def __init__(self, bridge, self.addCleanup(self.bridge.delete_port, port_name) ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper() self.port = ip_wrapper.device(port_name) self.ns_ip_wrapper.add_device_to_namespace(self.port) super(LinuxBridgeFixture, self).setUp() self.ip_wrapper = self.useFixture(NamespaceFixture()).ip_wrapper self.bridge = base.create_resource( BR_PREFIX, bridge_lib.BridgeDevice.addbr, namespace=self.ip_wrapper.namespace) self.addCleanup(self.bridge.delbr) self.bridge.link.set_up() self.addCleanup(self.bridge.link.set_down) def create_port_in_ns_fixture(self, ns_ip_wrapper): return """Simulate a bridge by creating a veth. :ivar ports: "bridge" veth port devices :type ports: IPDevice 2-uplet """ def setUp(self): super(VethBridgeFixture, self).setUp() self.veth_fixture = ns_ip_wrapper) class VethNamespacePortFixture(NamespacePortFixture): def __init__(self, unallocated_ports, ns_ip_wrapper): self.unallocated_ports = unallocated_ports self.ns_ip_wrapper = ns_ip_wrapper def setUp(self): super(VethNamespacePortFixture, self).setUp() try: self.port = self.unallocated_ports.pop() except KeyError: raise ValueError(_('VethBridgeFixture supports at most 2 ports')) self.ns_ip_wrapper.add_device_to_namespace(self.port) self.port.link.set_up() class CidrBoundNamespaceFixture(fixtures.Fixture): """Bind namespace to cidr (on layer 2 and 3). Create a port on the bridge in the namespace and set an ip on the port. :ivar port: created port :type port: IPDevice """ def __init__(self, bridge, ns_ip_wrapper, ip_cidr): self.bridge = bridge self.ns_ip_wrapper = ns_ip_wrapper self.ip_cidr = ip_cidr def setUp(self): super(CidrBoundNamespaceFixture, self).setUp() bridge_fixture = BridgeFixture.get(self.bridge) self.port = self.useFixture( bridge_fixture.create_port_in_ns_fixture(self.ns_ip_wrapper)).port self.port.addr.add(self.ip_cidr)

commit_message:
Remove setting language to en_US for 'venv'

Remove setting LANGUAGE=en_US for 'venv' virtualenv.

Since the 'venv' environment is not used for unittests and users may
want to see messages in their native language in the 'venv' virtualenv.

Also makes it consistent with python-ironicclient

Change-Id: I1902d162cc7a5a1c8ee2e6a7412096d645277cc0

commit_message:
Nova metadata protocol should be configurable

Metadata agent request nova metadata endpoint by default via http,
it will get issue if nova's endpoints are over https. The configuration
should be part of puppet.

Change-Id: Id57b81a8f8f0998f363ee9ee8f0a162d279dcaf9
Closes-bug: #1439034

commit_message:
Mock time.sleep() for two unittests

Two unit tests were reporting as taking over 5 seconds each.  Updated
them to mock time.sleep() and they no longer show up in the longest
tests list.

The unit tests were:
  * test_wsman_enumerate_retry()
  * test_wsman_invoke_retry()

Change-Id: I7c2a0539d239313f8706a0e8f24b3ff88cccf29f

commit_message:
Fix intermittent unit test failures

The following tests have been failing recently:

 test_update_add_locations_status_exception
 test_update_replace_duplicate_locations
 test_update_replace_locations_status_exception

They were querying storeurl.com which redirected to
www.hugedomains.com, and unexpected exchanges, eg:

 HTTP/1.1 302 Found.
 Cache-Control: private.
 Content-Length: 183.
 Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8.
 Date: Wed, 01 Apr 2015 19:05:15 GMT.
 Location: http://www.hugedomains.com/domain_profile.cfm?d=storeurl&e=com.
 Server: Microsoft-IIS/8.0.
 X-Powered-By: ASP.NET.
 Connection: keep-alive.

Mocking out the get_size function prevents these real connections.

Change-Id: Ia5d867f98ac60479c70362b0477c2a0571ac6e4f
Closes-bug: 1437346

commit_message:
Change where we look for ROOT_PATH

ROOT_PATH should be the parent of the directory containing local_settings.py,
setting it wrong has started causing problems as its now used as part of
CUSTOM_THEME_PATH.

Change-Id: I6306ec21813b672d44830f3bac81a5ea5fbde0dc
Closes-Bug: #1438133
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/97/169397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ROOT_PATH = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), ".."))

commit_message:
Combine test cases for checking nova limits response

nova rate-limit returns absolute limits too, but novaclient does
not show absolute limit,a bug
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+bug/1172254) has
been filed for this one. There is no test which assert on both
absolute and rate limit. This patch assert on both the rate and
absolute limit returned

Change-Id: Ia635f32eefc46e22e3f4e45a7885f492bb967a99
Closes-Bug: #1436653
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/76/167876/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_rate_limits_absolute_check(self): obj = self.cs.limits.get() expected = ( limits.AbsoluteLimit("maxTotalRAMSize", 51200), limits.AbsoluteLimit("maxServerMeta", 5), limits.AbsoluteLimit("maxImageMeta", 5), limits.AbsoluteLimit("maxPersonality", 5), limits.AbsoluteLimit("maxPersonalitySize", 10240), ) abs_limits = list(obj.absolute) self.assertEqual(len(abs_limits), len(expected)) for limit in abs_limits: self.assertIn(limit, expected)

commit_message:
Add help text to DeleteVolumeTransfer action

The DeleteVolumeTransfer action doesn't inherit from BatchAction
therefore does not get a default help_text attribute, this patch adds
help_text for the action so its consistant with the other delete
actions.
It also makes sure the confirmation dialog doesn't display undefined
help_text in the future.

Change-Id: Ib5bdd55931206d22095dc2872e45be017a57bdd1
Closes-Bug: 1437529
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/70/168870/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help_text = _("This action cannot be undone.")
